page.title: 13FARMING at WESTMILL
page.content: Mrs.Burns who owns the trout farm has been running it for seven years.The trout are kept in nine ponds which are in three acres of farmland. The River Rib which is nearby is the source of their water supply. There is about 100 million gallons of water going through these ponds a day. Altogether they have 75,000 trout which are bought as fry from Berkshire and are reared for the table. The fry are kept for at least nine months when they will weigh 8oz.but they can grow to 4lbs. They are fed three times a day on high protein pigmented pellets which make them look pink and shiny. The trout are available all the year round. There is no problem with pollution but the trout can get whirling disease which is not harmful to the fish or the consumer. The trout are sold either locally or in London.
